title.narrative: Almaz Capital Russia Fund II, LP

description.narrative: The proposed project is an investment of up to US$25 million in equity, not to exceed 20% of total fund commitments, in Almaz Capital Fund II, L.P., a Cayman Islands exempted limited partnership (the Fund), a venture capital fund sponsored by Almaz Capital Partners Ltd. (Almaz). Almaz is seeking to raise about US$175 million of aggregate commitments for the Fund, with initial closing targeted at US$100 million. This is the second fund to be managed by Almaz. Almaz successfully raised $72 million for the Almaz Russia Fund I in 2008/2009. The Fund will make venture capital investments in information technology (IT) companies in Russia and Commonwealth of Independent States ("CIS") with a focus on (i) proven technologies for global markets, developed in Russia/CIS; and (ii) proven business models targeted at Russian/CIS consumers. Target sectors include: (i) internet, software, and systems; and (ii) semiconductors and optoelectronics. The Fund aims to invest in 15-18 portfolio companies, each in the range of $7-16 million over the life of the investee company. The Fund plans to invest in 7-8 early stage companies; 5-7 mid-stage companies; and opportunistically invest in 2-3 late stage, pre-IPO deals. Finally, the Fund will allocate $5 to 10 million for early seed investments only to be invested with select angel investors (typically experienced technology entrepreneurs) as well as in cooperation with incubators and accelerators.

There is limited access to Western-style venture funding and support, a much needed ingredient for a successful telecoms, media, and related technology ("TMT") industry in Russia and Commonwealth of Independent States ("CIS"). The Fund will act as a catalyst to support the development of the technology sector and the growth of local entrepreneurship and innovation. It will facilitate the capacity development as well as sector knowledge and skill transfer while using global industry best practices in portfolio companies thereby enhancing their competitiveness and sustainability. In addition, the Fund will support the creation of new jobs as investee companies expand.
